org.usfirst.frc.team2473.framework.components

Class Controls

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usfirst.frc.team2473.framework.components.Controls

  • public class Controls
extends java.lang.Object
    This class stores all joysticks and buttons for tele-op use on the robot.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Deep Sethi, Harmony He

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Controls.ButtonAction
      Represents different button actions by the driver.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addButtonCommand(java.lang.String key, Controls.ButtonAction action, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Command cmd)
      Assigns a button action listener to a button with a given reference key, allowing for a Command to be canceled or run.
      void addJoystick(int port)
      Adds a joystick to the collection of joysticks with the given port number

      Returns a usable instance of this class for program use.

      Removes a given joystick from the collection of joysticks in this class.

        public void removeJoystick(int port)
        Removes a given joystick from the collection of joysticks in this class.
        Parameters:
        port - an int value representing the port of the joystick to be removed.

      • setButtonValue

        public void setButtonValue(java.lang.String key,
                           boolean val)
        Sets the pressed value of a given thread-safe button given its reference key.
        Parameters:
        key - a String representing the button reference key.
        val - a boolean representing the new pressed value of the button

      • addButtonCommand

        public void addButtonCommand(java.lang.String key,
                             Controls.ButtonAction action,
                             edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Command cmd)
                      throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                             java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Assigns a button action listener to a button with a given reference key, allowing for a Command to be canceled or run.
        Parameters:
        key - a String representing the key of the button to listen to
        action - a ButtonAction value representing an action to listen for
        cmd - a Command object representing the command to be run or canceled when the event has been fired
        Throws:
        java.lang.InstantiationException - if there is an error in Command instantiation
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the Command is not accessible
